messages.subject: Re: Off topic, trying to identify a samurai movie
messages.msgSnippet: Someone said in the comments: This is from Romantic Warriors (Nangman jagaek). You can find more details at IMDB: http://www.imdb.com/ title/tt0385115/
messages.messageBody:
Someone said in the comments: "This is from Romantic Warriors (Nangman
jagaek). You can find more details at IMDB: http://www.imdb.com/
title/tt0385115/"


--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, Anthony Bryant
<anthony_bryant@...> wrote:
>
>
> On Jun 18, 2008, at 7:42 AM, X wrote:
>
> >
> > I guess this might be a place to ask...
> >
> > Has anyone got a clue what movie this is taken from?
> > http://www.5min.com/Video/How-to-Win-a-Sword-Fight-4263624
> >
> >
>
> Well, for starters, it's Korean and has absolutely nothing whatsoever
> to do with samurai or Japan.
>
> But I would like to see the rest of it. ;)
>
>
> Tony
>

messages.subject: Re:Off topic, trying to identify a samurai movie
messages.msgSnippet: Nangman jagaek http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0385115/ That was posted on the video page. Available at crunchyroll.com Jim Eckman
messages.messageBody:
Nangman jagaek
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0385115/

That was posted on the video page. Available at crunchyroll.com

Jim Eckman

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Off topic, trying to identify a samurai movie
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, for starters, it s Korean and has absolutely nothing whatsoever to do with samurai or Japan. But I would like to see the rest of it. ;) Tony
messages.messageBody:
On Jun 18, 2008, at 7:42 AM, X wrote:

>
> I guess this might be a place to ask...
>
> Has anyone got a clue what movie this is taken from?
> http://www.5min.com/Video/How-to-Win-a-Sword-Fight-4263624
>
>

Well, for starters, it's Korean and has absolutely nothing whatsoever
to do with samurai or Japan.

But I would like to see the rest of it. ;)


Tony
